content: vivaldi spring mitts is the first pair in ***the four seasons*** collection it is widely believed that antonio vivaldi s inspiration for the four seasons stems from the time he spent as the court chapel master in the gorgeous countryside of mantua italy this is spring a tangle of leaves and tender shoots reach for the sun with buds ready to burst forth on the back of the hand and stockinette on the palm these mitts are sized for tiny smallish and larger hands using heavier yarn and larger needles the lace pattern is rhythmic and easy to memorize it is written for magic loop but could easily be adapted for dpns the lace portion is written and charted included is a tutorial for the easiest-ever *no-turn-bobble* vivaldi spring mitts have been test knit in lieu of paying a fee for this pattern please consider making a donation to world central kitchen since 2010 world central kitchen has been providing meals to communities affected by conflict natural disasters and climate crisis all over the world **https //wck org**
